title: 111_s3810
content: The Act titled "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" restricts participation in offshore oil and gas leasing. The Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act mandates that leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf include a certification requirement. The lessee must annually certify to the Secretary of the Interior that they do not engage in activities subject to sanctions under the Iran Sanctions Act. Failure to provide a truthful certification may result in lease cancellation. The Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act requires leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf to include a certification provision. The lessee must disclose any involvement in energy-related ventures outside Iran. Failure to provide accurate certification may lead to lease cancellation. The Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act mandates that leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf must include a certification provision requiring disclosure of any involvement in energy-related ventures outside Iran with blocked persons or entities. The Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act requires leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf to include a certification provision for disclosing involvement with blocked persons or entities. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to cancel the lease if false information is provided, with a waiver option available. The Secretary of the Interior can cancel a lease if false information is provided, with a waiver option available on a case-by-case basis. The Secretary must report any lease cancellations to congressional committees promptly. The Secretary of the Interior can cancel a lease if false information is provided, with a waiver option available on a case-by-case basis. The cancellation of a lease requires an explanation of reasons and must be reported to appropriate congressional committees. Definitions for "appropriate congressional committees" and "person" are provided in this section. SEC. 3. SUNSET. This Act will end 30 days after the President certifies to Congress that Iran has ceased supporting terrorism, pursuing weapons of mass destruction, and no longer poses a threat to US national security or allies.
